intro: Psychotria foveolata, commonly known as the "Coca plant" or "Yareta," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Psychotria foveolata is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in local communities for various purposes.
